intro: Monnina santamartensis, commonly known as the Santa Marta monnina, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, contributing to its overall low-growing structure. Monnina santamartensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
